i18n.title: Deferred Function Execution in Go
i18n.description: The defer statement is used to delay the execution of a function until the surrounding function returns. It is often used to ensure that some cleanup is performed after a function completes, regardless of the path taken to get there.

meta.title: Defer in Go Programming | Cleanup Execution
meta.description: Learn how to use the 'defer' statement in Go programming to ensure cleanup tasks are performed after a function completes, regardless of the execution path.
meta.keywords: Go programming, defer statement, cleanup, file management, error handling
